title: Problem 2107_C
statement: You are given an array a_1,a_2,...,a_n of length n and a positive integer k, but some parts of the array a are missing. Your task is to fill the missing part so that the maximum subarray sum^{\text{∗}} of a is exactly k, or report that no solution exists.Formally, you are given a binary string s and a partially filled array a, where: If you remember the value of a_i, s_i = 1 to indicate that, and you are given the real value of a_i. If you don't remember the value of a_i, s_i = 0 to indicate tha
